abstract: United States' top climate negotiator Todd Stern convenes with Chinese counterpart Xie Zhenhua during climate change summit in Los Angeles to announce joint actions in both countries to reduce greenhouse gas emissions; meeting is intended to show that United States and China are working to honor terms set at historic climate accord reached by Pres Obama and Pres Xi Jinping in Beijing in November 2014.
lead_paragraph: The meeting is intended to announce actions demonstrating that the countries are moving toward meeting the terms of a historic accord reached last year in Beijing.

headline.main: U.S. and Chinese Climate Change Negotiators to Meet in Los Angeles
headline.print_headline: Chinese and U.S. Climate Change Negotiators Meet

snippet: The meeting is intended to announce actions demonstrating that the countries are moving toward meeting the terms of a historic accord reached last year in Beijing.
